resolutions.text: Ivan to adjust language to reflect content creator/EPUBCheck responsibility for viewport.
Review RS specification for statements around RS behaviour for non-conformant EPUB publications, check if can they be removed safely.
Add a note to the specification identifying rendition:flow scrolled continuous as a possible option for webtoons in EPUB, it is being incubated and requesting feedback.
Once the edits are finalized, merge PR 2402 and close issue 2397.
Merge PRs 2400 and 2401.
The WG supports merging #2379 pending approval from the assigned reviewers..
Deprecate name and version properties on the epubReadingSystem object.
Deprecate Bridgehead, close issue 2327.
Define the meta viewport property with only the width and height attributes as a restriction on the CSS definition, close issue 2292.
Close issue 2270, don't fix.
Close issue 2261, won't fix.
proceed as described in https://github.com/w3c/epub-specs/issues/2322#issuecomment-1157847432 and then close the issue.
Recommend the user SHOULD be given notification about links and their destination as part of RS recommendations, close issue 2320.
Merge PR 2330, review remainder of specification for similar issues.
Remove file URLs, merge PR 2329 and close issue 2324.
Close issue 2323 as won't fix.
Add symbolic links to the threat model, investigate whether EPUBCheck can detect symlinks.
Close issue 2321, no change to current statement on network activity.
Approve PR 2297.
Approve PR 2299, close issue 2265.
Approve PR 2301, close issue 2264.
Close remaining privacy and security issues.
Adopt the recommended text in issue 2153, close issue.
Do a final update of the IDPF registry, add note that it will no longer be updated, accept PR 2233, close issue 2200.
Move EPUB 3.3 Core, EPUB 3.3 Reading Systems, and EPUB Accessibility 1.1 to CR, publication date May 5 (preliminary), pending all PRs are closed by April 15th.
Merge Pull Request #2101.
merge PR 2137, close issue 2118.
Merge PR 2106, close issue 2093.
Add note about container constraints to scripting section, close issue 2098.
Merge PR 2060, deprecate collections.
Merge PR 2027 after wording is confirmed, and close issue 2007.
Merge PR 2028, close issue 2024.
Merge PR 2002.
Adopt Brady's suggested text in issue 1483, close issue 1483.
Elevate requirement for media overlays to a SHOULD, close issue 1991.
Merge PR 1972.
Remove the legal reference from PR 1980, and merge 1980.
Use the term "under-implemented" to describe features that do not meet the 2-implementor threshold for CR, but need to remain in the specification.
Close issue 1921 with no change.
Elevate the default behaviour statements for rendition:orientation and rendition:spread to MUSTs.
Merge PR 1947 and close issue 1941.
Merge PR 1943 and not 1949.
Close issue 1913 once PR 1943 is merged..
Label "risky" features in the spec with a name TBD, would correspond to a flag in EPUBCheck.
We will not be adopting the HTML terminology for risky features, close issue 1942.
Merge 1898.
merge 1899.
disallow "out-of-container" relative URLs.
Approve PR 1903.
allow obsfucation only for fonts. Formally restrict to the font core media types. Add note suggesting using WOFF instead of obsfucation, and to say the intent is to cover all types of fonts..
Close 1874; remove para from spec that contains "This version of the specification does not require a specific format for DRM information, but a future version might. ".
merge 1889.
Merge PR #1725.
Publish the SSV as a working group note, using ECHIDNA, using the short name "epub-ssv"
Defer issue 1061 as a feature request, open new issue addressing remote resources and elements like <video>
Move the `epub:type vocabulary into it's own note
Merge PR 1816, close issue 1809
Merge PR 1808, leave issue 1799 open until schema issue is resolved
Move EPUB Accessibility FAQ to wiki on epub specs repo
Add explainer for WCAG 2.1 SC 2.4.6 in EPUB a11y techniques
Close issue 1793
Close issue 1782 with maximum prejudice (won't fix)
TPAC meeting with APA: Oct 28, 14 UTC to 16:15 UTC
25th october, similar timing, as backup
Clarify the language for landmarks, close issue 1761
Remove the search point from the SVG section, close issue 1774
Add clarifying link to authoring specification, label issue as EPUB next and close issue 1775
Add a note to the accessibility section of the reading systems document, add mention in FXL accessibility note, close issue 1776
Do a research study into the usage of the vocabularies in EPUB authoring
Explore removing the epub:type vocabulary from the specification and into it's own note
Merge PR 1756
approve issue #1738
Republish the latest revisions of EPUB 3.3 Core and Reading Systems
Merge PR 1751
Publish Text-to-speech Enhancements 1.0, with the short name "epub-tts" as a working group note

Change text for page-progression-direction to "When the default value of the page-progression-direction attribute is specified, or the attribute is absent, the Reading System can choose the rendering direction.", drop assertion, close issue 1482
Publish latest version of EPUB Accessibility 1.1 and EPUB Accessibility Techniques 1.1
Identify the source in the metadata only if the static pages correspond to another version of the publication, and not when the publication is source of its own pagination.
Provide a note in the core spec that this is a known issue, include non-normative advice about what to do, close issue 1687
close the issue 1300, since it is not looking high priority
Declare root relative paths not recommend (should not be used), close 1681
Discourage the use of <base> in EPUB, close issue 1699
Publish the EU Accessibility Mapping as a working group note, with the short name of "epub-a11y-eaa-mapping", and use the ECHIDNA publishing system to update when working group needs to
Remove SSML from the core specification, include along with PLS in a separate WG note
Remove PLS section from the authoring document, close issue 1690
Absolute URLs for manifest items should have a special scheme that is not file:, close issue 1688
approve request in issue #1695
Close issue 636, move discussion to the community group
our spec does not require SVG to be valid only well formed
dump xml:base from the spec
get rid of the hand-waving in PR 1671 on the origin issue
Close issue 1675 without further steps
republish all specs
Close issue 1298
Merge PR 1670, close issue 1303, forbidding fragment identifiers in hrefs for items
If a property is invalid, ignore it, close issue 1673
Make statement in issue 1659 normative
Close issue 1650
Use the WHATWG URL specification instead of the RFCs
Close issue 1509
Close issue 1505
Close issue 1504
Change the PR from 'deprecated' to 'should' and then merge
Add a note to clarify that a RS should do what it can with filenames that exceed the limit
Change requirement for case normalization to a MUST and specify which algorithm we will use
Close issue 1632
Merge PR 1616
Remove all references to custom attributes
Drop the statement in issue 1516
Flag appendix A as at-risk, keep as a normative requirement and test implementation, remove the WebIDL
Amend the RS section to allow RSs to do whatever they "damn well" please with CSS direction
Add accessibility technique for dc:source metadata.
add informative text for reading systems accessibility in the reading
Merge PR 1468
Merge PR 1588
Publish new drafts of the core, reading systems, and accessibility documents
Close PR 1584 with the new language around linear="no", close issue 1480
Merge PR 1582, open issue for TAG review
Relax the restriction on cardinality for OPF metadata
relax strict requirement of sequential page numbers in EPUB 3 specification
add non-normative text in ePUB Accessibility suggesting rechecking the publications for major changes that could effect
Accept PR 1573
embedded Data URLs are OK, but data URLs in <a> are forbidden; reading systems must not navigate to such URLs.
make distribution section non-normative and place a note that it is required by EU accessibility act
Close issue #1026, will not implement
Close issue 841, will not change usage of dcterms:modified
Close issue 588
Explore implementation of a media:paused class in EPUB 3.3
Close issues 1527 and 1553, add editorial note regarding the current use of dc:title on the market and edit the example
single string with three parts EPUB accessibility + WCAG version + level
delegate document for difference between Media Overlays, Audio books, read aloud etc to Publishing CG
Publish new drafts of the EPUB 3.3 Core and Reading Systems documents
Close issue 1509 with no action
close issue 1508, won't fix
Update the informative statement in the core specification about origin from "content document" to "EPUB", and "domain" to "origin"
publish FPWD of a11y spec and a11y techniques note
use echidna to publish a11y spec and a11y techniques
Add text for highlighting that AA is important for meeting European Accessibility Directive and section 508.
EPUB accessibility 1.1 approved for FPWD
add informative note for explaining diff between audio books, media ovelays and read aloud
Add the default value of auto to the dir element, resolved 1491 and 1499
Fix 1494 by removing the untrue statement about the relationship between dir and the underlying text
Close 1493 as we cannot fix this issue
close 1490 because mooted by PR 1498
Close 1489, we have met the i18n requirements
Close 1488, accept PR 1497
maintain recommendation of AA, but provide explanations why levels are recommended..
Close #1422, leaving the language in the content document as is.
Change the language for rendition:flow to define the default is auto, but remove the MUST statement/ untestable assertion.
remove language around the concept of a release identifier, while retaining the mandatory unique ID and dcterms:modified metadata.
make statement about uniqueness of unique ID in #1310 non-normative.
We are not having success criteria of aligning nav doc with spine, but we will have a technique for it..
associate CertifiedBy with CertifierCredentials with refine.
We will not add accessmodesufficient=visual for text content, instead we will clarify why it should not be done.
Refer to epub-specs GitHub issue tracker..
Remove mentions of multiple renditions from the core and reading systems documents, close issue #1436 and merge PR #1438.
Publish Multiple Renditions as a Working Group Note.
Publish Overview as a Working Group Note.
EPUB 3.3 will keep the concept of core media types as it is today.
Publish the EPUB Core and Reading System documents as FPWD in January 2021
Use the ECHIDNA publishing system
deprecate rendition:align-x-center pending confirmation on NA call
move to the 2020 patent policy
Merge PR #1368 to address outstanding DTD issues, and close GH issues 1369-1373
Merge #1347 with an additional warning about support for WebP
The nav order SHOULD match the spine order and the content order
remove bullet "External identifiers MUST NOT appear in the document type declaration [XML]." Add reading system conformance saying that reading systems SHOULD NOT validate against DTDs.
Add WebP as a core media type in EPUB 3.3
Add the media-type for OPUS/OGG to the core media types (address issue #645) with a note explaining the exception for Safari
we will publish the following documents: EPUB 3.3 Content, EPUB 3.3 RS, Accessibility 1.1, Media Overlays 3.3
The version of this revision of EPUB will be 3.3
